analysis_multi module¶

Created on Thu Jul 19 13:06:43 2018

@author: shrey

analysis_multi.categoricalDescription(df, colNames)[source]¶

This function creates a table that shows the analysis of appearnce count of the columns.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The pandas dataframe that contains data columns to be analysed.
  • colNames (list) – The list of column names to be analysed.
Returns:

A dict summary statistics plotly table and its label.
Return type:

dict
analysis_multi.correlationCategorical(df, colNames)[source]¶

This function correlation matrix for categorical variables using cramersV test.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The pandas dataframe that contains data columns to be analysed.
  • colNames (list) – The list of column names to be analysed.
Returns:

A dict with heatmap plotly graph and its label.
Return type:

dict
analysis_multi.correlationMatrix(colNames, corr_vals, variableType)[source]¶

This function generates a heatmap of correlation values between features.

Parameters:
  • colNames (list) – The list of column names to be analysed.
  • corr_vals (list) – The list of values for the correlation matrix.
  • variableType (String) – The type of variable, numeric or categorical.
Returns:

A dict with heatmap plotly graph and its label.
Return type:

dict
analysis_multi.correlationNumerical(df, colNames)[source]¶
analysis_multi.cramersV(confusion_matrix)[source]¶

calculate Cramers V statistic for categorial-categorial association. uses correction from Bergsma and Wicher, Journal of the Korean Statistical Society 42 (2013): 323-328

Parameters:confusion_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – Confusion matrix of features.
analysis_multi.numericalDescription(df, colNames)[source]¶

This function creates a table that lists out basic statistic result on the two datasets, such as mean, median, standard deviation, etc.

Parameters:
  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The pandas dataframe that contains data columns to be analysed.
  • colNames (list) – The list of column names to be analysed.
Returns:

A dict with summary statistics plotly table and its label.
Return type:

dict
